SEARCH
Package com.wjduquette.joe

Class Joe

java.lang.Object
com.wjduquette.joe.Joe
public class Joe extends Object
The Joe language interpreter. Clients create an instance of Joe, install any needed bindings, and then use it to execute Joe scripts.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Joe()
    Creates a clean instance of Joe.

  • Constructor Details

    • Joe

      public Joe()
      Creates a clean instance of Joe. It will include the complete standard library, but nothing else.

  • Method Details

    • getGlobals

      public GlobalEnvironment getGlobals()
      Returns Joe's global environment, for querying.
      Returns:
      The environment.

    • getVar

      public Optional<Object> getVar(String name)
      Gets a global variable's value by name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name
      Returns:
      The value, if found

      Sets a global variable's value by name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name
      value - The name

    • installPackage

      public void installPackage(JoePackage pkg)
      Installs a package into Joe's global environment.
      Parameters:
      pkg - The package

    • installGlobalFunction

      public void installGlobalFunction(NativeFunction function)
      Installs a native function into Joe's global environment.
      Parameters:
      function - The function

    • installType

      public void installType(TypeProxy<?> typeProxy)
      Installs a registered type's proxy into Joe's global environment.
      Parameters:
      typeProxy - The type proxy.

    • installScriptResource

      public void installScriptResource(Class<?> cls, String resource)
      Installs a resource file into the engine, executing it as a Joe script. This is the standard way to add library code written in Joe from within Java.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class
      resource - The resource name, including any relative path.

    • getOutputHandler

      public Consumer<String> getOutputHandler()
      Gets the client's output handler.
      Returns:
      the handler

    • setOutputHandler

      public void setOutputHandler(Consumer<String> outputHandler)
      Sets the client's output handler. By default, all script output goes to System.out.
      Parameters:
      outputHandler - The output handler.

    • println

      public void println(String text)
      Prints the text, followed by a newline, using the client's output handler.
      Parameters:
      text - The text

    • println

      public void println()
      Prints a newline using the client's output handler.

    • print

      public void print(String text)
      Prints the text using the client's output handler.
      Parameters:
      text - The text

    • runFile

      public Object runFile(String path) throws IOException, SyntaxError, JoeError
      Reads the given file and executes its content as a script.
      Parameters:
      path - The file's path
      Returns:
      The script's result
      Throws:
      IOException - if the file cannot be read.
      SyntaxError - if the script could not be compiled.
      JoeError - on all runtime errors.

    • run

      public Object run(String source) throws SyntaxError, JoeError
      Executes the script, throwing an appropriate error on failure.
      Parameters:
      source - The input
      Returns:
      The script's result
      Throws:
      SyntaxError - if the script could not be compiled.
      JoeError - on all runtime errors.

    • stringify

      public String stringify(Object value)
      Stringify converts an object to its string representation, as visible at the scripting layer. Normally, this is the same as object.toString(), but there are special cases.
      • The null value stringifies as "null".
      • Doubles with integer values stringify without the ".0".
      • Instances of Joe classes can provide a stringifier.
      • Java class bindings can provide a stringifier.

      This method would be static except that it will need to reference the engine's data for non-standard types.

      Parameters:
      value - The value being stringified.
      Returns:
      The string

    • codify

      public String codify(Object value)
      Converts a value to a string as it would appear in Monica code. This is intended primarily for use in error messages, but could also be used during code generation.
      Parameters:
      value - The value
      Returns:
      The value

    • typeName

      public String typeName(Object value)
      Gets the script-level type of the value, or null if null. This is primarily for use in error messages.
      Parameters:
      value - The value
      Returns:
      The type string, or null.

    • classTypeName

      public String classTypeName(Class<?> cls)
      Gets the script-level type name of the given class.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class
      Returns:
      The name

    • escape

      public static String escape(String string)
      Given an arbitrary string, escapes all typical control characters as they would appear in Java or Joe code.
      Parameters:
      string - The input string
      Returns:
      The string with escapes

    • isTruthy

      public static boolean isTruthy(Object value)
      Returns true if the object is "truthy", i.e., boolean true or non-null, and false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      value - The value
      Returns:
      true or false

    • isEqual

      public static boolean isEqual(Object a, Object b)
      Returns true if the two values are equal, and false otherwise. This is essentially equivalent to Objects.equals(a, b).
      Parameters:
      a - The first value
      b - The second value
      Returns:
      true or false

    • compare

      public static int compare(Object a, Object b)
      Compares two objects, returning -1, 0, or 1, provided they are both Strings or both Numbers
      Parameters:
      a - the first object
      b - the second object
      Returns:
      -1, 0, or 1

    • isIdentifier

      public static boolean isIdentifier(String name)
      Determines whether the name is a valid Joe identifier or not.
      Parameters:
      name - The name
      Returns:
      true or false

    • isPackageName

      public static boolean isPackageName(String name)
      Determines whether or not this is a valid Joe package name.
      Parameters:
      name - The putative name
      Returns:
      true or false

    • call

      public Object call(Object callee, Object... args)
      Calls a JoeCallable value with the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      callee - A Joe value which must be callable.
      args - The arguments to pass to the callable
      Returns:
      The result of calling the callable.

    • arityFailure

      public static JoeError arityFailure(String signature)
      Returns a "Wrong number of arguments" JoeError for a method or function with the given signature. This is primarily used by the arity checker methods, but can also be used by native functions and methods at need.
      Parameters:
      signature - The signature
      Returns:
      The error, to be thrown.

    • exactArity

      public static void exactArity(ArgQueue args, int arity, String signature)
      Throws an arity check failure if the arguments list contains the wrong number of arguments.
      Parameters:
      args - The argument list
      arity - The expected arity
      signature - The signature string.
      Throws:
      JoeError - on failure

    • minArity

      public static void minArity(ArgQueue args, int minArity, String signature)
      Throws an arity check failure if the arguments list contains fewer than the minimum number of arguments.
      Parameters:
      args - The argument list
      minArity - The minimum arity
      signature - The signature string.
      Throws:
      JoeError - on failure

    • arityRange

      public static void arityRange(ArgQueue args, int minArity, int maxArity, String signature)
      Throws an arity check failure if the arguments list contains the wrong number of arguments.
      Parameters:
      args - The argument list
      minArity - The minimum arity
      maxArity - The maximum arity
      signature - The signature string.
      Throws:
      JoeError - on failure

    • expected

      public JoeError expected(String what, Object got)
      Factory, constructs a JoeError to be thrown by the caller.
      Parameters:
      what - What kind of value the caller expected
      got - The value the caller got
      Returns:
      The error

    • toComparator

      public Comparator<Object> toComparator(Object arg)
      Converts a Monica comparator callable to a Java comparator.
      Parameters:
      arg - The callable
      Returns:
      The comparator

    • toDouble

      public double toDouble(Object arg)
      Requires that the argument is a Double, and returns it as a double for further processing.
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      the value
      Throws:
      JoeError - if the argument is not a Double.

    • toInteger

      public int toInteger(Object arg)
      Requires that the argument is a Double, and returns it as an integer for further processing. Any fractional part is truncated.
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      the value
      Throws:
      JoeError - if the argument is not a Double.

    • toIndex

      public int toIndex(Object arg, int limit)
      Requires that the argument is a Double, and returns it as an integer in the range 0 to limit - 1 for further processing. Any fractional part is truncated.
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      limit - The maximum index - 1, e.g., the size of a list.
      Returns:
      the value
      Throws:
      JoeError - if the argument is not a Double or is out of range.

    • toKeyword

      public Keyword toKeyword(Object arg)
      Requires that the argument is a Keyword, and returns it as such.
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      The keyword
      Throws:
      JoeError - if the argument is not a keyword

    • toList

      public JoeList toList(Object arg)
      Requires that the argument is a JoeList, and returns it as such.
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      The list
      Throws:
      JoeError - if the argument is not a JoeList

    • toString

      public String toString(Object arg)
      Requires that the argument is a String, and returns it as such. Contrast this with stringify(), which converts the argument to its String representation. Which to use is sometimes a matter of need, and sometimes a matter of taste.
      Parameters:
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      The string
      Throws:
      JoeError - if the argument is not a String

    • toType

      public <T> T toType(Class<T> cls, Object arg)
      Requires that the argument be assignable to a variable of the given class, and returns it as such.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The required value type.
      Parameters:
      cls - The class
      arg - The argument
      Returns:
      The value as cast
      Throws:
      JoeError - if the argument is not a valid T.

    • wrapList

      public JoeList wrapList(List<?> list, Class<?> itemType)
      Given an arbitrary Java list, wraps it as a JoeList and ensures that any added values are can be assigned to the given itemType. Updates made by the script will update the underlying Java list. If this is not desired, either use `Joe::readonlyList()` or return it as a new `ListValue`.
      Parameters:
      list - The list to wrap
      itemType - The type
      Returns:
      The wrapped list.

    • readonlyList

      public JoeList readonlyList(List<?> list)
      Given an arbitrary Java list, wraps it to be read-only. It can be accessed freely at the script level, but not modified.
      Parameters:
      list - The list to wrap
      Returns:
      The wrapped list
